revised_title: Roman Altar Inscription and Worship of Matres
tldr: This article discusses the discovery of a Roman altar with an inscription found in York. The inscription mentions the worship of female deities called Matres in Roman territories. The author provides a brief explanation of the inscription and explores the different opinions of writers on the nature of these deities. The article also examines the title and employment of the person who dedicated the altar.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
